title.native: メカクシティアクターズ

description:
The incidents which occurred on August 14th and 15th bring a group of young boys and girls together… They are members of a group they call themselves the “Mekakushi Dan” (Blindfold Organization) and each member possesses a strange power involving their eyes. Will the members of this peculiar organization be able to solve the mysteries behind these incidents and see the truth?

(Source: Aniplex USA)

A story based on the new popular series of songs by Jin (Shizen no Teki-P) titled "Kagerou Project".

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Vocal Synth
tags.description: Features one or more singers or characters that are products of a synthesize singing program. Popular examples are Vocaloids, UTAUloids, and CeVIOs.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

node.description:
[Website](https://jin-jin-suruyo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jin_jin_suruyo)

 Jin, also known as Shizen no Teki-P is a sound producer, composer, and arranger from Japan He was influenced by his keyboardist uncle and started learning keyboard at the age of 6. He has also been influenced by bands such as THE BACK HORN and composers such as Satoru Kosaki.  He is a relatively new producer, having only been active since early 2011, but is quickly becoming well known. On September 30, 2011, Jin submitted the song “Kagerou Days” (カゲロウデイズ) to Nico Nico Douga. The song quickly gained popularity and has since been viewed more than 3,000,000 times.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Website](https://jin-jin-suruyo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/jin_jin_suruyo)

 Jin, also known as Shizen no Teki-P is a sound producer, composer, and arranger from Japan He was influenced by his keyboardist uncle and started learning keyboard at the age of 6. He has also been influenced by bands such as THE BACK HORN and composers such as Satoru Kosaki.  He is a relatively new producer, having only been active since early 2011, but is quickly becoming well known. On September 30, 2011, Jin submitted the song “Kagerou Days” (カゲロウデイズ) to Nico Nico Douga. The song quickly gained popularity and has since been viewed more than 3,000,000 times.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/wannyanpu_ppp) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=4048471)

Wannyanpu is an illustrator and movie producer most notable for her fanmade PV of Shizen no Teki-P's Heat-Haze Days which achieved over 800,000 views.

__[Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/1500261) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dsd_kgn) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dsd_kgn/) __

__Sidu__ is a female Japanese mangaka, designer, animator and illustrator.
Former key member at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
Former key member at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/y_kaele)

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined an adult game brand (スタジオルクス) which he soon left. He entered [Studio Pastoral](https://anilist.co/studio/299/Studio-Pastoral) after which he started working on [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft) shows and became part of the main staff for most of their works.

Genichirou Abe is one of studio SHAFT's best and most respected animators being involved on nearly every major SHAFT production and even being included among the episode 15 [Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Gurren-Lagann) all-star staff.

Abe's animation is characteristically layered and dense, and the way he draws hair, skin, and clothing with ruffles warrants comparison to [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/Hironori-Tanaka), who collaborated on Bakemonogatari. Many of his cuts have the Ohira wobble. Abe has said he enjoys doing background animation and integrates it into many of his scenes.

Genichirou Abe is one of studio SHAFT's best and most respected animators being involved on nearly every major SHAFT production and even being included among the episode 15 [Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Gurren-Lagann) all-star staff.

Abe's animation is characteristically layered and dense, and the way he draws hair, skin, and clothing with ruffles warrants comparison to [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/Hironori-Tanaka), who collaborated on Bakemonogatari. Many of his cuts have the Ohira wobble. Abe has said he enjoys doing background animation and integrates it into many of his scenes.

Abe's animation is characteristically layered and dense, and the way he draws hair, skin, and clothing with ruffles warrants comparison to [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/Hironori-Tanaka), who collaborated on Bakemonogatari. Many of his cuts have the Ohira wobble. Abe has said he enjoys doing background animation and integrates it into many of his scenes.

Originating from [Nippon Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/22/). Directs on rare occasions.

Worked for Square Enix in Honolulu, Hawaii together with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and others for the first decade of the 2000s and was completely absent from the anime industry because of this. Returned in 2011 and has been active since.

Yuuki Yase is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He joined Satelight in 2005 as a production manager. In 2010, Yase joined Shaft as an episode director, and made his series directorial debut with Hidamari Sketch x Honeycomb. He left Shaft in 2018, and is currently freelance.

Yuuki Yase is a Japanese director and storyboard artist. He joined Satelight in 2005 as a production manager. In 2010, Yase joined Shaft as an episode director, and made his series directorial debut with Hidamari Sketch x Honeycomb. He left Shaft in 2018, and is currently freelance.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.
Affiliated with Studio Shaft and Aniplex.
